activities.loc: Monroe County Justice Center - Branch II

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on November 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Andrew Theodore Stubrud appeared by phone.  Attorney Craig Gericke appeared by video for Andrew Theodore Stubrud.  Attorney Charles David Betthauser appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney waives reading of criminal complaint and waives time limits for a preliminary hearing. Charges and max penalties were read.

records.addlTxt:
No consumption or possession of alcohol.  No entering taverns, bars or liquor stores for any purpose. 
No acts or threats of violence. 
DEFENDANT MUST COMPLY WITH THE BOND MONITORING PROGRAM.  
DEFENDANT MUST GO IMMEDIATELY TO THE JUSTICE PROGRAMS OFFICE UPON SIGNING OF BOND AND/OR RELEASE.  
THE BOND MONITORING PROGRAM IS LOCATED IN THE MONROE COUNTY JUSTICE CENTER AT 112 SOUTH COURT STREET, ROOM 1008, SPARTA, WI.

Defendant Andrew Theodore Stubrud appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Croninger appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Caulum appears via zoom video. Victim R.H.K. appears via zoom video (audio only). Victim request the no contact order not to be ordered. Defendant is on probabtion. Court orders $500 signature bond with conditions.
Initial appearance scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Initial appearance on September 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
